description: Cumulative counting sequence: method A (adjective-before-noun)-pairs, starting with 3.
comments: Segments (generated as at A217760):  3; 1,3; 2,3,1,1; 3,3,3,1,1,2; ...The 4th segment is read "3 3's and 3 1's and 1 2" as a record of what was previously written; 3 3 1 are adjectives and 3 1 2 are nouns.  Conjecture: every nonnegative integer occurs. - _Clark Kimberling_ Mar 25 2013
example: Write 3, thus having 1 3, thus having 2 3's and 1 1, thus having 3 3's and 3 1's and 1 2, etc.
mathematica: s = {3}; Do[s = Flatten[{s, {Count[s, #], #} & /@ DeleteDuplicates[s]}], {14}]; s (* Peter Moses, Mar 21 2013 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_, Apr 27 2000
